title: Analytic manifold
summary: In mathematics, an analytic manifold, also known as a C Ï‰ {\displaystyle C^{\omega }} manifold, is a differentiable manifold with analytic transition maps.[1] The term usually refers to real analytic manifolds, although complex manifolds are also analytic.[2] In algebraic geometry, analytic spaces are a generalization of analytic manifolds such that singularities are permitted.
